title: South Live: Thursday 18 January - BBC News
summary: presenter chris tarrant pleads guilty to drink-driving .
windy weather leaves thousands without power .

documents.title: good evening
text: thank you for joining us today .
we will be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all of the region 's latest news , travel , sport and weather .

documents.title: pc james dixon 'one of life 's legends '
text: samantha dixon , the widow of pc james dixon , who died last month has described him as `` one of life 's legends '' .
the police officer - who had appeared in the sky tv programme road wars - was killed when his motorcycle was in a collision with a car near hare hatch
gladys goodwin , who was in the car , also died in the crash .
in mrs dixon 's statement , released on the day of her husband 's funeral , she said : `` today we said our final goodbyes to james dixon , or dixie as he was affectionately known by many .
`` he was a loving husband , excited father to be , caring son and brother and genuine friend to many we are all truly heartbroken and devastated by his loss .
`` his death leaves behind a hole that can never and will never be filled .
he will be missed forever and never forgotten . ''

documents.title: funeral for road wars police officer
text: funeral for road wars police officer

documents.title: former cardiologist from sandhurst jailed for military sex attacks
text: a former consultant has been jailed for carrying out sex assaults on military personnel at a hospital in surrey .
neil ineson , 60 , from sandhurst , in berkshire , was convicted of 11 offences at frimley park hospital between 2008 and 2014 after a trial on 4 april 2017 .
he was sent to prison for four years at guildford crown court .
details could not be reported until a second trial in connection with a separate allegation , of which he was found not guilty , had taken place .
the former cardiologist was also placed on the sex offenders register for 10 years .
a statement from frimley health nhs foundation trust said ineson was suspended as soon as the first accusation was brought to its attention in november 2014 .

`` to date , the investigation has found that all the victims were military personnel who were being examined by dr ineson , a former army colonel , as part of the trust 's contract with the ministry of defence , '' it added .

documents.title: rail closures between newbury and reading
text: work to electrify the railway between reading and newbury will result in a number of closures in 2018 , it has been announced .
the first phase of work between 12 and 15 march will see buses replacing trains between pewsey and theale .
once finished , great western railway ( gwr ) says the work will allow its new electrostar trains to run direct to london .
it will also start operating intercity express trains beyond newbury to bedwyn and direct to wiltshire , devon and cornwall .

documents.title: new role for oxfordshire mp
text: robert courts has been appointed to be parliamentary private secretary ( pps ) for ministers at the foreign office .
a pps is an mp who assists ministers and acts as their `` eyes and ears '' in the house of commons .
mr courts , a conservative mp for witney , says he 's looking forward to starting the new role .

documents.title: londoners spend 37 % of salary on rent , study reveals
text: renters in london are spending an average of 37 % of their earnings on rent , according to a new study .
the average monthly rent in the capital is now £ 836 while average monthly earnings are just less than £ 2,300 , said jobs site cv-library .
other cities with high rents included brighton at £ 623 a month , 32 % of average wages , edinburgh ( £ 463 , over 23 % ) , bristol ( £ 458 , almost 22 % ) and southampton ( £ 418 , around 21.8 % ) .
people living in such cities could be heading towards `` debt levels '' each month , the report said .
the city with the highest monthly pay was aberdeen at £ 2,300 .
lee biggins , managing director of cv-library , added : `` while some cities offer manageable living costs and generous pay packets , others could be pushing workers to breaking point . ''

documents.title: 'rude ' hospital staff to undergo training
text: 'rude ' hospital staff to undergo training

documents.title: gang force their way into southampton home
text: a masked group forced their way into a home in vanguard road , southampton , on sunday before leaving empty-handed .
police said just after 23:30 a woman knocked on the door and as someone answered the door , a group of four masked people forced their way in demanding property .
the group left shortly after entering the home without stealing anything or threatening any violence .
it is believed they may have targeted the wrong address .
the woman who knocked on the door was white , late 20s or early 30s , 5ft 4ins , slim , pale and malnourished , with dark blonde hair .

documents.title: bayeux tapestry 'could be displayed at winchester castle '
text: the leader of hampshire county council has suggested the bayeux tapestry be displayed at the great hall of winchester castle .
it is set to be displayed in the uk after france agreed it could leave its shores for the first time in 950 years .
the tapestry tells the story of the future william i 's conquest of england , culminating in the battle of hastings and the defeat of harold in 1066 .

council leader roy perry said : `` winchester great hall is the second largest medieval hall in england after westminster hall , and winchester was the anglo-saxon capital of england at the time of the norman conquest .
`` as a gesture in return , and subject to specialist advice , we could perhaps loan to france , king arthur 's round table which is on display in winchester 's great hall .

`` of course , further discussions and tests will need to be carried out to make sure the 11th century artwork would be safe to move from its current home in bayeux , normandy , just as we would need to be sure it is safe to transfer the round table from winchester to france . ''
mr perry said he had written to the prime minister 's office about the offer .

documents.title: new seaside garden plan submitted
text: three portland stone shell sculptures will be at the centre of a new seaside garden in poole .
it has been designed to have views of the wooded chine onto the beach and beyond to the purbeck hills .
four new beach huts have also been included in the plans which have been submitted by the borough of poole .
the authority says it 's set to cost about £ 55,000 .

documents.title: water main bursts on hayling island
text: please see our statement regarding our ongoing works and the traffic disruption in # haylingisland .
we apologise for the inconvenience this has already caused and will cause over the coming hours .
is there a diversition to get on and off the island after 8pm ?
the current diversion through northney road will remain in place throughout the night so people can still get on and off the island , it will just take longer than normal .
thank you
we 're on site and will be shutting in the main causing the water showing on havant road , by victoria road in # haylingisland .
this may result in some reduced pressure .
updates will continue

documents.title: new mental health scheme launched at reading school
text: a school 's new mental health intervention scheme is proving a success as pupils suffering from depression and anxiety benefit from group therapy sessions .
the pilot study is being run by the university of reading at theale green school .

documents.title: wolf escaped 'after gate left open '
text: wolf escaped 'after gate left open '

documents.title: rochdale sign midfielder dobre on loan
text: rochdale sign midfielder dobre on loan

documents.title: u 's striker to stay on loan
text: oxford united striker james roberts will be staying on loan at guiseley until the end of the season .
the 21-year-old joined the national league side in december and has scored three goals in five starts .

documents.title: future of banbury court at risk
text: the closure of banbury magistrates ' and county council is being proposed by the government .
it is one of eight courts that could be shut down by the ministry of justice .
the government department - which has started a consultation on the plans - says `` digital reforms '' mean there are many more ways to access justice which do n't require attending court .
under the proposal the work done by banbury 's court would be reallocated to other courts close by .

documents.title: electricity returned after power cuts
text: ssen has restored power to around 22,000 homes following overnight power cuts .
just under 500 customers are currently off supply across southern england .
the disruption follows strong winds of more than 80mph which caused disruption across the uk .

documents.title: investigation into 'blood covered ' kidnap attempt
text: police are trying to trace a man thought to have been at the centre of an attempted kidnap in southsea .
at about 14:45 yesterday two white men were seen assaulting a black man who they put in the back of a black toyota aygo with a red roof .
they were all covered in blood .
it happened near to stratford house on earlsdon road .
the car then drove towards the seafront with the back door open .
a little later the victim was seen walking near stratford house , towards leamington house .
det sgt marcus mills said : `` we 're concerned for the welfare of the victim in this incident and so we 're appealing for him to come forward .
`` i would like to reassure the public that this type of report into an attempted kidnap is rare , however we have increased police patrols in the area . ''

documents.title: south western railway lines reopen
text: south western railway says all its lines are now open , after several trees fell onto the railway due to high winds .
`` clearly there will be residual delays while the service recovers , '' a spokesman said .
18/01 - update @ twitterid have worked hard to clear several fallen trees on the south western railway network .
we are anticipating delays of up to 40 minutes until 4pm .
trains to portsmouth may be disrupted beyond that time .
check before travelling

hi , trains are running between windsor and staines , there is no replacement service in place .

awesome !
thank you for the swift response : )

documents.title: escaped wolf 'never a threat to public '
text: teresa palmer , 62 , who founded the sanctuary , helped to encourage the 12-year-old wolf into a caged trailer before it was taken back to its home .
she said : `` the fact he went through a field of sheep on his way shows he would never be a threat to the public . ''

documents.title: wolf recaptured by police and sanctuary staff
text: wolf conservation trust staff and thames valley police officers managed to detain and recapture the wolf , reportedly named torak , in the berkshire village of curridge .
it was at large for about six hours and was `` recaptured unharmed '' , police said .

documents.title: breakingwolf escaped from berkshire sanctuary caught
text: a wolf that escaped from a berkshire sanctuary when strong winds brought down fencing has been recaptured .
the animal is thought to have fled from the wolf conservation trust 's site in beenham at about 08:00 this morning .
thames valley police said the wolf had been `` recaptured unharmed '' .
schools no longer had to keep their pupils indoors , it added .
good news a wolf in west berkshire which had escaped has been recaptured unharmed .
thank you to everyone in the community for your patience and understanding while we were dealing with the incident .
schools , which were asked to keep pupils indoors , no longer need to do this .
at around 8am today the force received a call reporting a wolf had escaped from a sanctuary in picklepythe lane , beenham .
the wolf moved to curridge where it was safely detained by officers and staff from the sanctuary , who had been working to recapture it .
thank you for capturing him safely !
great news thank you @ twitterid

text: chris tarrant banned for drink-driving

text: washed up hand case remains a mystery

documents.title: bird flu zone extended across england
text: bird flu zone extended across england

documents.title: breakingescaped wolf sighted eight miles from sanctuary
text: a wolf is still on the loose in west berkshire and was last spotted near the village of curridge .
this is eight miles from beenham , which is where the wolf conservation sanctuary is located .
a bbc reporter on the scene says the police helicopter is circling overhead , with a team of police and animal experts on the ground who are trying to capture the wolf using a tranquiliser dart .

documents.title: freshwater bay woman 's hand case remains a mystery
text: the identity of a woman whose hand was found on an isle of wight beach more than a year ago remains a mystery .
the remains were found by a dog at freshwater bay on 28 december , 2016 .
police later confirmed the hand was from a woman 's body .
analysis also showed it had been in the sea for a considerable length of time .
hampshire constabulary said officers were now focusing on burial grounds at sea to establish if there is any connection .

documents.title: chris tarrant : 'i 'm very sorry '
text: chris tarrant has been given a 12-month driving ban and fined £ 6,000 after pleading guilty to drink-driving .

the 71-year-old dj and tv presenter was found in december to have 50 microgrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of breath ( the legal limit being 35 microgrammes ) while behind the wheel of his car .
leaving reading magistrates court , mr tarrant said : `` i 'm very sorry .
i honestly did n't think i was over but apparently i was , so it 's fair enough '' .

documents.title: wolf escapes after 'wind damage '
text: a wolf on the loose in berkshire reportedly escaped from a sanctuary when strong winds brought down fencing .
local parent tony roe told the bbc police officers were outside their child 's local primary school by 08:30 to usher pupils inside .
mr roe said : `` an officer on the school gate told me a wolf had escaped after wind blew down part of the fence . ''
meanwhile , thames valley police has texted residents warning them about the escaped animal and children are being kept inside schools .

documents.title: travel disruption as high winds and snow hit uk
text: severe gales have been causing disruption to much of the uk - with gusts of up to 83 mph ( 134 kph ) .
rail commuters are facing delays in london , wales , norfolk , suffolk , cambridgeshire , buckinghamshire , surrey , sussex and hampshire .
in sydenham , south east london , a train has hit a tree .
damage to overhead electric wires is causing problems for train services in the midlands , and drivers are being warned to take extra care on the roads .
in east anglia and south-east england more than 59,000 homes have lost power .

documents.title: pc james dixon 's funeral to take place later today
text: the funeral of pc james dixon is due to take place in pangbourne this morning .
pc dixon was on duty when he was killed along with a 91-year-old woman in a crash on the a4 in berkshire in december .
around 500 police officers and mourners are expected to attend the service for the 39-year-old who had appeared in the sky tv programme road wars .
craig o'leary from the police federation has pledged the `` police family '' will continue to support pc dixon 's widow samantha .

documents.title: bird flu prevention zone declared across england
text: a bird flu prevention zone has been declared across the whole of england after 31 infected birds were identified in dorset .
chief veterinary officer nigel gibbens made the announcement after 13 dead wild birds were confirmed to have the virus in warwickshire .
it means it is a legal requirement for all bird keepers to follow strict biosecurity measures .

a defra spokesman said : `` these latest results show the disease is not isolated to a single site the decision has been taken to extend the prevention zone across the country on a precautionary basis . ''
public health england has advised the risk to public health remains very low .

documents.title: breakingtarrant handed driving ban over drink-driving
text: radio host and tv presenter chris tarrant has been given a road ban after pleading guilty to drink-driving .
the 71-year-old was over the limit while behind the wheel of his mercedes on 16 december in bucklebury , close to his home in berkshire .
tarrant , wearing a navy suit and striped tie , entered a guilty plea to the charge at reading magistrates ' court this morning .
he was disqualified from driving for 12 months and fined £ 6,000 .
the court heard tarrant 's breathalyser reading was 50 microgrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of breath - the legal limit being 35 microgrammes .

documents.title: breakingchris tarrant pleads guilty to drink-driving
text: radio host and tv presenter chris tarrant has pleaded guilty at reading magistrates ' court to drink-driving .

documents.title: emily maitlis fears stalker will never stop
text: emily maitlis says she fears her stalker will never stop harassing her after the former friend was jailed at oxford crown court for breaching a restraining order .
the newsnight presenter compared living with two decades of harassment to having a chronic illness .
speaking to bbc radio 5 live 's emma barnett show , she said it had had a devastating impact on her family .
she said : `` you turn into this person who shouts at your kids for the wrong thing . ''
she also described her frustrations with the legal system and called for a new approach to treating stalkers .

documents.title: 'bin massacre ' after high winds in oxfordshire
text: the great bin massacre - storm damage could take months to recover from , local emergency declared @ twitterid @ twitterid

get the gardening gloves on .
all cleared up ( how did the soya milk carton travel quite so far ? )
and then the park scoured for windfall kindling !
now i must finish this darn article and not be distracted by twitter !

documents.title: escaped wolf : children being kept inside
text: after reports of a sighting of an escaped wolf near a school , pupils are being kept indoors .
sian champkin , whose husband works at elstree school in woolhampton , says that students are being told not to go outside .
the sighting at the school was at about 08:00 today , at the same time as police said they were called .

documents.title: wolf warning for residents
text: people living in beenham and surrounding areas of berkshire have been sent a text message by police warning of the wolf on the loose .
the animal escaped from the wolf conservation trust in beenham , berkshire , this morning .
police are currently on scene .

documents.title: ww2 spitfire pilot mary ellis given freedom of isle of wight
text: a woman who delivered spitfires and bombers to raf airfields during world war two has been awarded the freedom of the isle of wight .
councillors voted to honour mary ellis , 100 , the last known surviving pilot of the air transport auxiliary ( ata ) .
isle of wight council leader dave stewart described her an `` national , international and island heroine '' .
mrs ellis delivered around 1,000 aircraft on her own - including spitfires and wellington bombers - to the raf equipped with only a compass , stopwatch and map to find the airfields .
the dangerous work carried out by the ata was vital to the war effort in keeping squadrons replenished with aircraft .
after the war mrs ellis moved to the isle of wight and managed sandown airport from 1950 to 1970 .
although i have travelled extensively during my life , the island has always been home and is such a special place to me .
thank you for granting me the freedom of this wonderful island . ''

documents.title: wolf on the loose in berkshire
text: a wolf has escaped from a sanctuary in beenham , reading .
thames valley police has confirmed it was called at around 8:00 today reporting a wolf had escaped from the sanctuary in picklepythe lane .
officers have sight of the wolf and are working with staff from the sanctuary to detain it .
police are advising members of the public not to approach the wolf if they see it .

documents.title: quadruple amputee has microchip implant to unlock doors
text: a quadruple amputee has had a microchip implanted in his arm that allows him to open doors .
the chip allows alex lewis to open his front door with a sweep of his arm , rather than taking him up to 15 minutes using ordinary keys .
mr lewis , from stockbridge in hampshire , had to have his limps amputated in november 2013 , when he was rushed to hospital with a streptococcal infection ( type a ) .
he hopes the implant can be used for other tasks in the future .

documents.title: 'rude ' oxford hospitals parking staff to undergo training
text: car park staff at a hospital trust will go on training courses after patients complained about their rudeness .
oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust said the `` conflict resolution training '' would help staff `` deal with vulnerable people '' .
trust non-executive director and vice-chairman geoffrey salt called the current situation `` appalling '' .
parking at the trust 's site had been repeatedly criticised by patients .

documents.title: power cut for 2,900 customers in the south
text: scottish and southern electricity has reported about 2,900 of its customers in the south are currently without power after last night 's high winds .
a spokesman said : `` all faults have been resourced and we expect power to be restored in stages throughout the course of today
`` we would encourage customers affected to call us on 105 for an update . ''
the company supplies electricity to hampshire , berkshire and oxfordshire and wiltshire .

documents.title: today 's weather for the south
text: today 's weather for the south

documents.title: winds bring down trees causing delays and cancellations to train services
text: rail passengers are facing travel disruption after many trees were blown down in gales overnight .
trains to waterloo from southampton , bournemouth and portsmouth are disrupted .
all lines are blocked between guildford and havant .
disruption is expected until 10:00 gmt .
a tree is also blocking the line between eastleigh and basingstoke .
train services running through these stations may be cancelled , delayed or revised .
disruption is expected until 09:00 gmt .
important notice due to several incidents of fallen trees we are currently experiencing an extremely high number of queries .
we may not be able to answer all tweet as fast as usual .
please bear with us .
thank you .
see here for service updates :

if you get to the station , find all viable trains are cancelled and go home , rather than wait an hour for a train which may also be cancelled how is that refunded , given it 's not covered by delay repay ?
hi phil , delay repay applies if you actually travel , there are separate arrangements in place if you choose not to travel here : ^pn
so if my 8:03 train is cancelled at guildford and the subsequent 4 how does that work ?
do i get delay repay from @ the train i should have got that was called last minute ?
yes , you enter the train you were planning to catch , if it was cancelled the system can see this and will work out the delay from there .
^pn
have you considered cutting back the bigger at risk trees along the tracks to mitigate this annual problem when we get a bit of wind ?
our colleagues @ twitterid do have a rigorous system in place for this , but will not be able to account for every eventuality i 'm afraid .
^pn

i paid the full ticket price , i was expecting some kind of rebate as 2017 was very unkind to the commuter .

documents.title: 'extreme commuter ' travelling world by bus visits oxford
text: adham fisher has been `` extreme commuting '' all over the world since 2004 and has been invited to oxford to try out its buses .
the leicester man has a guinness world record for the fastest time to travel to all of the berlin u-bahn metro stations .

documents.title: missing 10-year-old girl from poole found safe
text: dorset police officers searching for missing 10-year-old chloe rosenberg said she has been found safe and well .
chloe went missing from her home in upton road , poole , at around 17:55 yesterday .
searches were carried out in poole and bournemouth and chloe was located by officers just before 20:40 in the poole area .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to bbc south live .
we will bring you the latest headlines from across the region along with sport , travel and weather updates until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with us using our oxford , hampshire , dorset , and berkshire facebook pages , or via our twitter accounts : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
